ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Devangari script, sentence constructions, Hindi grammar
I learned how to read, write, and speak elementary hindi.
I learned new words and grammar structures in Hindi.

I learnt basic hindi vocabulary and grammar, as well as some basic knowledge of Indian culture and customs. I also became very familiar with the Devangari writing script over the course of the semester.
Learned how to write in Hindi, basic Hindi grammar, and vocabulary. Had some experience speaking and understanding basic Hindi sentences.
This course gave me a strong background in hindi.
I learned about how to write and read in the Hindi script and techniques for learning and practicing language
Hindi 110 was a good introduction to the language and grammar. It is fast-paced at first, but once you have a basic understanding of the script, it becomes a much easier learning process.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The teachers are great, but a little unorganized. Some days the homework that was due for the day would be posted at 8pm the day before it was due which made the small simple assignments quite burdensome. Also, the book they follow is in an illogical order, and I wish they would structure their class in their own way instead of following the book to a tee. However, I really enjoyed my time in the class and was surprised at how much I learned.
The class was enjoyable but the workload and course content was a bit disorganized.

The greatest strength of the class is that the professors and TF are warm and approachable and create a wonderful class atmosphere. I definitely bonded with my classmates and improved my Hindi. The greatest weakness of the class is that it often felt disorganized. We would be assigned homework on Canvas around 6:00pm in the evening that was then due at 9:00am the following morning. In class, we sometimes went on tangents that were counterproductive and frustrating. We rarely got practice worksheets. It would be helpful for the professors to create more opportunities for practice and feedback, to assign homework earlier, and to set clearer agendas for each class.

This course did a good job in introducing grammar concepts and the Devangari script. However, I feel like the course was held back by the textbook, which introduced concepts and vocabulary in a peculiar order that didn't make much sense. I also think that more time could have been spent on learning vocabulary in class.
Course was fairly disorganized compared to other languages Ive taken at Yale.
Strengths: amazing faculty, engaging environment. Weakness: weekly quizzes were sometimes stressful, but they were overall fine
Strength: Class was very flexibly taught and made learning hindi enjoyable.
This course was not as organized as it could've been. The professors are always there to help if you need them, however, sometimes the classes felt unprepared.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you have a background in Indic languages, this course will be a great enrichment for you. If you don't, it may be a little harder to follow but still a rewarding experience.
Absolutely, I really enjoyed this course.
I would recommend this course only to students who care about learning Hindi. You have to put in your own work to understand the concepts.
I would recommend this course if you are interested in learning Hindi. You will learn a lot and it is a low stress course in general, though the organization of the course could use some work.
Yes! The Hindi Department is amazing here, and the class is super fun.
Yes

If you want to learn the script and get a basic introduction to Hind, it is great. You definitely have to do some self-learning to keep up, but overall I enjoyed the course. The professors make it fun to learn.
